com.characterforming.jrte.base

Class BaseInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.characterforming.jrte.base.BaseInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IInput

    public abstract class BaseInput
extends java.lang.Object
implements IInput
    Base IInput implementation class implements mark() and reset(). Subclasses must implement get() to return the next sequential block of input.
    Author:
    kb

      • current

        public java.nio.CharBuffer current()
        Description copied from interface: IInput
        Peek at the current buffer. Implementations must retain this reference to the most recent return from get().
        Specified by:
        current in interface IInput
        Returns:
        The current buffer, which may be spent, or null if get() not yet called.

                throws InputException

        Returns:
        true if no more input

      • get

        public abstract java.nio.CharBuffer get()
                                 throws InputException
        Description copied from interface: IInput
        Get the next block of input from the source. The returned buffer may contain mixed text (Unicode) and signal ordinal values. If the position returned with the previous call is less than the limit returned from that call, the previous buffer should be returned and with the updated position and limit.
        Specified by:
        get in interface IInput
        Returns:
        The next block of input char, or null
        Throws:
        InputException - On error

      • got

        protected void got(java.nio.CharBuffer buffer)
        Subclasses must call this from their get() method passing the buffer (or null) to be returned from get(). Has no effect unless this has a mark.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to be returned from get()

      • mark

        public boolean mark()
             throws InputException
        Description copied from interface: IInput
        Mark a position in the input stream. The implementation class may set an upper bound on the number of marked characters. Calls to reset() may fail after this limit is reached.
        Specified by:
        mark in interface IInput
        Returns:
        true unless at end of stream
        Throws:
        InputException - On error

      • reset

        public final java.nio.CharBuffer[] reset()
        Description copied from interface: IInput
        Reset stream input at a previously marked position and clear the mark.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface IInput
        Returns:
        An array of buffers containing marked input up to current position
